title: How to make a movie without a camera
subject_group: Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Motion pictures - Study and teaching
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Cinematography - Special effects
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Motion pictures - Aesthetics
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Motion picture projection
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Motion pictures - Study and teaching
Crafts & Visual Arts/Art and motion pictures
description: Presents the results of efforts made to produce a film without a camera, using the following techniques to produce striking effects: vegetable dye colouring, felt-tipped pen, sprays and fingerprints all individually applied to clear leader; and scratching and perforating of opaque leader. The film is especially useful to young filmmakers.
